samples.input: Who created the R programming language?

messages.content: Who created the R programming language?

content.text: R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand. They began the project in the early 1990s, with the first version released in 1995. The name "R" comes from the first letter of both creators' first names. R was developed as an implementation and extension of the S programming language, which was created at Bell Laboratories.

R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand. They began the project in the early 1990s, with the first version released in 1995. The name "R" comes from the first letter of both creators' first names. R was developed as an implementation and extension of the S programming language, which was created at Bell Laboratories.

samples.input: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

messages.content: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

content.text: Version 1.0.0 of the R programming language was released on February 29, 2000. This marked R's first official stable release, though development of R had begun in the early 1990s by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand.

Version 1.0.0 of the R programming language was released on February 29, 2000. This marked R's first official stable release, though development of R had begun in the early 1990s by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand.
